constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: CONARA Name: Park Road Conservation Area
LOCCEN Name: Kingston Hill and Park Road

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Change of use from vacant Shop (Class  A1) to Non Residential Institution (Class D1).
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The use to which this permission relates shall only operate between the hours of 09.00am and 18.00pm Monday to Sunday.  Reason: To safeguard the amenities of local residents, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The exterior of the timber panelling hereby approved shall be finished in a colour to match the frame of the existing shop front. Reason: In the interests of visual amenity in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy, 2012.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details have been assessed by relevant consultants and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details, in relation to details required for  Conditions 3 (Materials), 14 (Construction Management Plan), 15 (Levels), 17 (Nature Conservation Scheme) and 23 (Detailed Drawings) of planning permission 22/00568/FUL, which states:Condition 3: Prior to above ground works the following details shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, implemented prior to occupation and thereafter permanently retained:(a)  materials for all external finishes and window frames (including their manufacturer's specification, colour and texture).The development shall then be carried out in strict accordance with the approved samples.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D4 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.Condition 14: Prior to commencement of any development on site, a Construction Management Plan detailing the following:(a) Provision for loading/unloading materials.(b) Storage of plant, materials and operatives vehicles.(c) Signing system for works traffic.(d) Measures for the laying of dust, suppression of noise and abatement of other nuisancearising from development works.(e) Means of enclosure of the site.(f) Wheel washing equipment.(g) The parking of vehicles of the site operatives and visitors(h) The erection and maintenance of security hoarding. shall be submitted to the planning authority for written agreement. The development shall only be implemented in accordance with the details and measures approved as part of the construction management plan, which shall be maintained throughout the entire construction period.Reason: These details are required prior to commencement of development because the relevant works would take place at the beginning of the construction phase and in order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and to safeguard highway safety and the free flow of traffic in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.Condition 15: Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, details of the existing and proposed levels across the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development and to ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.Condition 17: Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, a scheme to enhance the nature conservation interest of the site shall be submitted to and agreed in writing by the local planning authority. The approved scheme shall be implemented in full prior to beneficial occupation of the development.Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.Condition 23: Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, detailed drawings at a scale of 1:10 of the following features shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority: Windows, including any aprons, sills, mouldings, heads, jambs, transoms, mullions, lintels or reveals, Doors, including the door surrounds and recess details, Rain Water Goods, Soffit and Fascia. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012

Planning, Design and Access Statement - this supporting document was referenced in the Cover Letter, but was omitted from the submission documents. Please submit the Planning, Design and Access Statement.

If your application is for a change of use and no change is proposed to the external elevations a statement must be  included to state that no external changes are proposed. However, it is noted that the ground floor rear fenestrations are proposed to change and front fenestrations are in different locations along the front elevation, therefore Elevation drawings are required.
